author: Dena Aubin
title: Judge tosses much of lawsuit over TIAA retirement plan loans
text:
A federal judge in Manhattan has dismissed much of a proposed class action accusing financial services firm TIAA of collecting unlawful compensation on loans that borrowers took out from their retirement accounts.
In a decision on Wednesday, U.S. District Judge Paul Oetken dismissed four out of five claims against Manhattan-based TIAA, saying the complaint did not allege that TIAA actually exercised discretion over loan interest rates to boost its compensation. Without exercising such discretion, TIAA was not acting as a fiduciary liable for violating the Employee Retirement Income Security Act (ERISA), Oetken said. ERISA requires fiduciaries to run plans solely in the interest of participants.
To read the full story on Westlaw Practitioner Insights, click here: bit.ly/2GUzzqr
